channel.title: High detail mode
channel.description: Hello, I was wondering what the requirements were to connect to a server, with the client being in high detail mode. Everytime I try to log into my server with high detail, It does the initialize method(iirc), and then crashes. Is it one of those things like 508's where if the mode is high detail, it reads an extra byte and then continues normally, or am I missing something else?

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ok, here’s what you don’t understand…

It is a blank 377 cache. Blank 317 client that’s loading the 377 cache.

When I connect to a server, that has high detail compatibility, and nothing more, it works fine. All it has is login, plater rendering, and walking. That right there tells you its not a client problem.

When I connect to that same server on low detail, it looks fine.

When I connect to my server on low detail, it works fine.

When I connect to my server THAT’S MISSING SOMETHING IN THE CLIENT LOGIN AND RSA BLOCK, it doesn’t work.

Do I have to keep explaining this to you. You must have NO fucking idea of how the client works at all.

Read full topic

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Dude, your just being an idiot, l didnt say your server didnt cause the problem, all i said was its also a client problem, when a client will not accept something, it causes a client sided problem, that is what ive been saying this whole fucking time. So keep going and looking like an idiot

Read full topic

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

That’s it…

ARE YOU FUCKING STUPID???

Blank 377 cache, with a blank 317 client, connecting to another 317 server. Works perfectly fine.
Blank 377 cache, with a blank 317 client, connecting to my 317 server, THAT’S MISSING FROM THE RSA LOGIN BLOCK WHEN THE CLIENT CONNECTS = SERVER PROBLEM

Don’t mess with me. I’ll blow your mind.

Read full topic

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

zyle1992:

Hmm, you havent even been around here as long as i have. You think you know all about the clients, but in acuality you dont. The HD problem your having is in fact a client sided peice, because it is loading something that is crashing the client from a server sided command. Simple as that. So umm, who doesnt know about the client?

CoonHunter: Registered February 24, 2009, 09:53:45 am
zyle1992: Registered November 03, 2006, 12:23:06 am

Really… I haven’t been here as long as you… Hmm… You must be the one on the shortbus that licks the windows…

And if it were a client sided problem, then no matter what server I would connect to, it would have the same effect on all of them. Since in fact, High detail works on other servers I connect to, it is thus not a client problem, but a server problem.
[/quote]
Do i need to explain this? The server you are connecting to is showing an interface, npc, or object that the HD mode does not accept. Thus infact, being a client sided problem. I am not saying it isnt the server causing the problem. Its just a simple fact that its the client accepting the problem, not the server. Get used to it.

Read full topic

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @elijah101 elijah101
item.description:
@elijah101 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:8, topic:291825”]Am I the only one here that knows ANYTHING about the client???

  1. If you look, at a 317 deob, compile and run, It will ASK YOU if you want lowmem, or highmem
  2. As for the 508 reference, in 508’s the only way for 508’s to load HD, is if it reads one more signed byte when logging in. I’m asking if that is the same sort of thing I need to do for 317’s. Such as read 1 more byte, or short, or ByteA when the client connects.
  3. It is in fact NOT a problem with the client, because I tried connecting to a server in high detail more, worked perfectly fine. The reason I posted in THIS section is because a majority of the threads in the Server Help Get bumped down by 30 more people asking for help, getting almost no help in that matter. I on the other hand try to help as many people as I can.[/quote]

You don’t get that 508 has a HD cache, and 317s is a texture edit =p

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hmm, you havent even been around here as long as i have. You think you know all about the clients, but in acuality you dont. The HD problem your having is in fact a client sided peice, because it is loading something that is crashing the client from a server sided command. Simple as that. So umm, who doesnt know about the client?
CoonHunter: Registered February 24, 2009, 09:53:45 am zyle1992: Registered November 03, 2006, 12:23:06 am

Really… I haven’t been here as long as you… Hmm… You must be the one on the shortbus that licks the windows…

And if it were a client sided problem, then no matter what server I would connect to, it would have the same effect on all of them. Since in fact, High detail works on other servers I connect to, it is thus not a client problem, but a server problem.

Read full topic

  1. If you look, at a 317 deob, compile and run, It will ASK YOU if you want lowmem, or highmem
  2. As for the 508 reference, in 508’s the only way for 508’s to load HD, is if it reads one more signed byte when logging in. I’m asking if that is the same sort of thing I need to do for 317’s. Such as read 1 more byte, or short, or ByteA when the client connects.

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @elijah101 elijah101
item.description:
@elijah101 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:291825”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=385625.msg2891255#msg2891255 date=1248919429]
It’s for a 317 server. I was saying an example would be how the 508 handles high and low detail.
[/quote]
THen yes, i agree with elijah101, you are the one on the shortbus. Never use a 508 analogy for a 317 server. First of all, there is no such thing as a HD 317 server, all we can do is load new textures. Second, the analogy you used explained NOTHING about your problem. The problem your having is within the client itself. Try getting a new client.[/quote]

WORD.

Read full topic

item.title: High detail mode
item.dc:creator: @elijah101 elijah101
item.description:
@elijah101 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:3, topic:291825”]Are you shortbus???

Listen, I explained the problem well. If i start the client in low detail mode, it works fine. if i load it in high detail mode, it doesn’t load. it goes to about the initialize() method, and then crashes.[/quote]

  1. i found out your problem , so your on the shortbus for not

  2. don’t dis-respect my disabilities, its uncalled for!

Anyways your problem is, you need a 508 cache and heres your download link http://uploading.com/files/CMDR0/..html although, your missing something from the download link, it will come up invalid, if you want the real one say your sorry!

Read full topic
